title: Calories in Rice Crispy Treats
meta_description: Discover calories in rice crispy treats, including full nutrition breakdown per treat, macros, and easy tweaks for homemade versions.
assumptions: Standard store-bought or homemade; one square ~22g, made with Rice Krispies cereal, marshmallows, and butter; no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, recipe, size, and ingredients like butter type or cereal brand. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One standard rice crispy treat contains about 90 calories and 18g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Homemade with extra butter (1 tsp more)
Add chocolate chips (1 tbsp per treat)

faqs.q: How many calories in one rice crispy treat?
faqs.a: About 90 calories for a standard 22g treat.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in rice crispy treats?
faqs.a: One treat has 18g carbs, mostly from marshmallows and cereal.

faqs.q: Do rice crispy treats have protein?
faqs.a: Minimal, about 1g per treat from the cereal.

faqs.q: How does homemade vs store-bought differ in calories?
faqs.a: Homemade can vary; extra butter or nuts increase calories by 20-50 per treat.

faqs.q: Are rice crispy treats high in sugar?
faqs.a: Yes, one treat contains 8g sugars, mainly from marshmallows.
